pros: Cedarville taught me how to be a leader who lives by example and isn't afraid to show their weaknesses.
cons: Being a RA sometimes means "working" during unexpected hours to care for students in your hall.

pros: Good job, especially if you like working with people.
cons: Have to be always on and available, difficult conversations sometimes.

pros: Great colleagues Great students Strong community
cons: Lack of transparency about salaries Low salaries

pros: - Faith first, God fearing people who want the best college education and experience for students. - Leadership genuinely cares about the Faculty and Staff at Cedarville. - The students are awesome to be around. - A sense of working for a higher purpose
cons: - Pay could be better, but culture, work, and the fact that it is a non-profit, make up for it.

review_title: Rinnova is a lovely place to work.
pros: It is a face-paced environment in which the days go by quickly. The employees are helpful and kind. The management keeps work fun and easy.
cons: There are some times when the quickness of the job can get stressful. You may have to think quickly on your feet if a problem arises.

job_title: Dining Hall Employee in Cedarville, OH
pros: The entire company culture is very genuine and overall positive.
cons: Specifically in the dining hall, training is minimal and your first shift or two might be a bit overwhelming, but it balances out eventually.

pros: Really wonderful people to work with.
cons: Can sometimes be hard to make needed change in the job. The wheels move slowly.

pros:
Great and flexible envirment. Many wonderful people! Great community! Nice and affordable cafeteria. Cheaper than packing meals. Tuition Remission for full time employees and immidiate family.

It is also great if you are a new to the professional relm and need experience. Is a great resume boaster. Easy to get experience and shift around to different positions if you want to gorw in different ways (skillswise not income wise).
cons:
Low pay across the board. Could get paid 10k+ more anywhere else doing the same thing. Expanding too quickly. Hiring not matching growth rate.

Main incentives for working here long term are if you are a new professional and need expereince, you or an immidiate family member needs tuition remission, you consider this your ministry or you like the environment and don't need the income/are a dual income home. 

In the middle of no where. Which is nice if you like a commute or want to live in a very small country town. Must commute to grocery store pretty much everything is out fo the way. The Univerisity is 90% of the town.

pros: I loved that there are paid creative positions for students, and that the yearbook is student led to give students opportunities to gain experience and practice their skills. The community and friendship within the team was great. The work hours were very do-able for a student, only 2 or so hours in office a week with a 1 hour meeting once a week, and the rest of your work time is on your own schedule. The pay is pretty good for that amount of time.
cons: There were just some issues with the program we were using to make the yearbook, and the scheduling was a bit cramped closer to the end of the semester so we ended up not being able to finish the book completely, so next year’s team had to finish it.

pros: People, environment, location, flexibility, tuition reimbursement, direct management gives direction and then allows you to get the work done.
cons: Pay, benefits, understaffed, $$ seems to drive many decisions, no set pay scale (pay is determined by your hiring negation skills), very little opportunities for promotion or advancement.

pros: Great team of enthusiastic people.
cons: It can be a lot of hours which can be good and bad.

pros: Worked for a short period, clear communication and realistic expectations.
cons: Did not work long enough to decide cons

pros: I learned a lot about customer service and how to operate in a fast paced environment
cons: majority of the management does not care about their workers. as full time students we were asked to prioritize work and I was yelled at by management in front of my employees and customers for refusing to work over 40 hours a week

pros: Flexible and awesome leadership. Great hours and great space to work in.
cons: You need to have some experience with video or graphic design, it just makes the job easier.

review_title: Low-paying college job, but good experience
pros:
Flexibility
Autonomy
Some form of income
Fun, welcoming work environment
cons:
Lack of guidance
Lack of organization

pros: Many friendly staff members and managers
cons: Christian environment, feels very constricting, mundane, and very draining on an introvert

pros: Great, fantastic work place, friendly and open-minded
cons: low paying rates that may not appreciate the hard work

review_title: Cedarville University: A Great Place to Teach
pros:
Wonderful facilities, with excellent technology availability
Faith-based education. We understand that God heals whom He will; As healthcare providers, we have the privilege of "helping"
Great colleagues
cons: A few colleagues don't understand "allied health professions, and their importance.

job_title: Student Administrative Assistant in Cedarville, OH
pros: good supervisor, great work environment
cons: variable hours and lower wages

pros: Great space and community to work in
cons: Sometimes it was a little slow paced

pros: A great place to grow and learn. I have been discipled and pushed to mature spiritually while also receiving an excellent, personal biology education. I could not recommend more highly.
cons:
- Expensive. This can be circumvented to an extent with scholarships. 
- Poor communication

pros: -Great experience, Great people, Flexible hours
cons: -Pay is a bit subpar

review_title: Good fit for those passionate about teaching from a biblical worldview
pros: Faithful to its missional purpose
cons: It's definitely not a fit for everybody.

job_title: Tier I Technician in Cedarville, OH
pros: -Gain experience as well as a degree.
cons: -Must have Christian values and maintain the lifestyle

pros: I loved working as a RA at Cedarville because there was such a great relational atmosphere between the RAs and other students. I loved that I was being paid to have my door open, ready to counsel, encourage, and be there for other girls in my hall.  Even though I was kind of "always" on call, it didn't feel like work most of the time. I would definitely prefer it to working in the cafeteria or another job where you have to be there certain hours each day.  It was a very relaxed job most of the time.
cons: This totally depends on which Resident Director you are working with, but our RD wasn't very relational, even though that's a huge part of the job. Interactions with her were kind of forced, and she wasn't super approachable.  She pressured us to get girls in our halls to participate in events she came up with, even though many of the girls had said many times they were not interested. I felt pressured to pressure them. Also, I thought the pay could have been a little higher or at least covered room & board.

review_title: Stellar Professional Development, Encouraging Work Environment
pros:
-Christ-centered university. 
-Close department and team. 
-Great training, both initial and continual.
-Great benefits, time-off incentives. 
-VP of division listens to entry-level employees more than most VPs would
-Pay in line with CCCU average
-Supervisor balances friend/mentor role with manager role very well
-Clear goals
-Opportunities for professional development. Most who have left this department have gone on to do whatever they want to do
-Opportunities for advancement in salary and position, both within department and within the university
-Opportunity to travel
cons:
-Potential for long weeks: 50-55hr range in peak seasons. This comes with the job, though.
-While pay is in line with CCCU averages, the compensation is on the low end compared to amount of work done, expectations placed upon department/employees.
-See Advice to Management

review_title: Beautiful Campus, Friendly People, Pleasant Work Environment
pros: Friendly co-workers, great opportunities to interact with faculty, staff, and students. The people I worked with genuinely cared about each other and the University. Good benefits. Solid reputation.
cons: Salaries/wages are initially reasonable, but annual cost of living adjustments don't track with inflation historically, so it's not uncommon to have employees with years of service that are making less than new hires. I hope they've addressed this, or will consider doing so.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Cedarville, OH
pros: Christian environment with warm fellow employees.
cons: As many Christian institutions do, Cedarville University takes enormous advantage of employees.  Since full time employees get tuition remission for children, Cedarville gets around this by working "part time" employees 38 to 39 hours! In many cases there is little chance for advancement and "raises" are practically non-existent! The people are wonderful, but if you actually want to make a living look elsewhere!

pros:
Good company
Good job for students
Get to usually interact with others more than other jobs
Works around school schedules and other jobs
Good experience
Can deposit directly into student account to pay off schooling
cons:
Minimum wage
Not many hours
No room for advancement
Only 2 main areas of work - Cafeteria and Snack Shop, unless you know someone
In order to get jobs other than the food industry, have to apply as a sophomore or freshman for the coming school year. Won't accept Juniors or Seniors for jobs.

review_title: Good place to work if you fit with the culture here
pros: There is a generally positive environment here, with plenty of opportunity to make great friends.  The town is peaceful and quaint.
cons: The views and philosophy of this school can often be viewed as narrow-minded and controversial. It can be a very hard and discouraging place to be if you have different beliefs. Strongly recommend carefully reviewing the school's documents before accepting a position.

job_title: Food Service, Catering Services, Production Services in Cedarville, OH
pros:
Opportunities in food service and catering services for students. 
Generally very flexible hours.
Management of food service was driven and had a heart for the employees.
Recent changes in food service management saw vast improvements in quality as a whole.
cons:
Compensation is low. 
While there is some student management positions it is not easy to advance. 
To my knowledge, there are no raises available to students.
Not a lot of options for students besides food service.

pros: Hard-working colleagues, pleasant students, safe campus
cons: Extremely fundamentalist administration and Board of Trustees, no academic freedom in the liberal arts--censorship policy exists

pros:
Allowed for you to have a flexible schedule and
there was also not a lot of pressure to deal with.
cons:
Little communication between the professor and I, and that led to some confusion. 
Students that handed in homework late made things a little annoying.

review_title: Cedarville University, certainly one of the best experiences, but perhaps not the best of the best.
pros: Christ-centered environment, genuine and deep concern for students and fellow faculty, opportunity to change lives
cons: lack of creativity on the part of the University as a whole. Red-tape occasionally gets in the way.

review_title: I worked with student life programs as a student employee.

pros: the culture and professional development was superb.  I loved the comrade and the programs we built.
cons: sometimes, the job eats weekends.

review_title: Summer full of intense and slow times
pros: When things are slow there is a lot of free time. Meals were provided. Great bond between members if it is a good group.
cons: During the busy times it is constant go. There is not much sleep or time to do other things.

review_title: My experience at CU was tolerable.

pros: I had flexible work hours.
cons: My job was phased out by the introduction of a major for journalists.

pros: Great team. People actually care about you. Sometimes you get perks like food. Get to help grow a community in your hall which is very rewarding
